bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note
bioghist.p: Poppe (1897-1991) was a prominent Russian linguist and a member of the Akademiia Nauk SSSR (Soviet Academy of Sciences) in the 1930s and early 1940s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: In the recording he discusses the Soviet Academy of Sciences' (Akademiia Nauk SSSR) importance, its size and membership, salaries and living costs, daily life, commute, medical care, and living space for his family. He also talks about foreign literature and writing. The recording, in which Poppe speaks in English, is more than five hours in duration. Sergei Yacobson is believed to have played some role in the creation of this recording.

did.unittitle: Disc recording of N. N. Poppe on the Academy of Sciences parts 1 and 2

scopecontent.p: Poppe speaks on the import and membership of the academy. He describes life in the academy, usually focusing on cost, in the areas of various canteens, foreign books/literature, commuting, medical care, and the living space of his family; The disc begins with a short explanation of the cutting/recording process.
